list_definition.definition: a large fire in the open air, often built to celebrate something

list_ex_of_english: I undertook to visit all these cities prior to this bonfire night to promote safety awareness.
Go on, make a bonfire of another 100 000 pieces of legislation!
In my opinion, this is not a glimmer—it is a bonfire, a blazing bonfire of public cash.
We all know of minor irritations between neighbours; for example, garden bonfires or music being played too loudly.

In some cases, anticlericals painted churches red, heaped religious images on the bonfire and performed liturgical burlesques in which bulls were crowned bishop.
